page.title: 01INTRODUCTION.
page.content: Our D block lies 15 miles S.W.of Stafford in the heart of the country. The largest village to locate on the map is Wheaton Aston.This is where our school is situated.Other villages in the block are Lapley and Longnor.The land surrounding these villages is fairly flat.Flat enough in fact to border onto an old airfield which is now farmed.The runways on the airfield still exist. Farming is the major factor which gives the area it's character and flavour.Crops such as barley,winter wheat,rape and the occasional field of potatoes and peas are grown by the famers.However the largest proportion of the land is used for grazing cattle and sheep. Within the block there are many buildings of interest and some indication of a Roman settlement.
